page.title: 09Landfill Site, Kesgrave
page.content: There is a Suffolk County Council landfill site in our area, formerly a disused sand and gravel pit. It has been in use since 1982. The annual input of waste is 99,300 tonnes. Household waste collected by the District Councils accounts for 38,000 tonnes and another 15,800 tonnes is brought direct to the site by individual householders. The site deals with about 2,000 tonnes of rubbish every week. The large pits at the site are filled with rubbish and then covered with topsoil so that the land can be used for farming again. It will take another two and a half years to fill up this landfill site. Some of the refuse can be salvaged and recycled. It takes 600 dustbins to fill a dustcart and there are 19 cartloads brought to the site each weekday.
